members.name: upKey
members.comment: As of Java 2 platform v1.3 this previously undocumented field is no longer used. Key bindings are now defined by the LookAndFeel, please refer to the key bindings specification for further details.

members.name: downKey
members.comment: As of Java 2 platform v1.3 this previously undocumented field is no longer used. Key bindings are now defined by the LookAndFeel, please refer to the key bindings specification for further details.

members.name: leftKey
members.comment: As of Java 2 platform v1.3 this previously undocumented field is no longer used. Key bindings are now defined by the LookAndFeel, please refer to the key bindings specification for further details.

members.name: rightKey
members.comment: As of Java 2 platform v1.3 this previously undocumented field is no longer used. Key bindings are now defined by the LookAndFeel, please refer to the key bindings specification for further details.

members.name: calcRect
members.comment: A rectangle used for general layout calculations in order to avoid constructing many new Rectangles on the fly.

members.name: createLayoutManager
members.comment: Invoked by installUI to create a layout manager object to manage the JTabbedPane.

members.name: installComponents
members.comment: Creates and installs any required subcomponents for the JTabbedPane. Invoked by installUI.

members.name: createScrollButton
members.comment: Creates and returns a JButton that will provide the user with a way to scroll the tabs in a particular direction. The returned JButton must be instance of UIResource.

param: direction - One of the SwingConstants constants: SOUTH, NORTH, EAST or WEST
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if direction is not one of NORTH, SOUTH, EAST or WEST

members.name: uninstallComponents
members.comment: Removes any installed subcomponents from the JTabbedPane. Invoked by uninstallUI.

members.name: setRolloverTab
members.comment: Sets the tab the mouse is currently over to index. index will be -1 if the mouse is no longer over any tab. No checking is done to ensure the passed in index identifies a valid tab.

param: index - Index of the tab the mouse is over.

members.name: getRolloverTab
members.comment: Returns the tab the mouse is currently over, or -1 if the mouse is no longer over any tab.

return: the tab the mouse is currently over, or -1 if the mouse is no longer over any tab

param: width - the width to get the baseline for
height - the height to get the baseline for
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is < 0
return: baseline or a value < 0 indicating there is no reasonable baseline

members.name: getBaselineResizeBehavior
members.comment: Returns an enum indicating how the baseline of the component changes as the size changes.

param: c - JComponent to return baseline resize behavior for
return: an enum indicating how the baseline changes as the component size changes

members.name: getBaseline
members.comment: Returns the baseline for the specified tab.

param: tab - index of tab to get baseline for
throws: IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= tab count)
return: baseline or a value < 0 indicating there is no reasonable baseline

members.name: getBaselineOffset
members.comment: Returns the amount the baseline is offset by. This is typically the same as getTabLabelShiftY.

return: amount to offset the baseline by

members.name: paintTabArea
members.comment: Paints the tabs in the tab area. Invoked by paint(). The graphics parameter must be a valid Graphics object. Tab placement may be either: JTabbedPane.TOP, JTabbedPane.BOTTOM, JTabbedPane.LEFT, or JTabbedPane.RIGHT. The selected index must be a valid tabbed pane tab index (0 to tab count - 1, inclusive) or -1 if no tab is currently selected. The handling of invalid parameters is unspecified.

param: g - the graphics object to use for rendering
tabPlacement - the placement for the tabs within the JTabbedPane
selectedIndex - the tab index of the selected component

members.name: getTabLabelShiftX
members.comment: Returns the tab label shift x.

members.name: getTabLabelShiftY
members.comment: Returns the tab label shift y.

members.name: paintTabBorder
members.comment: this function draws the border around each tab note that this function does now draw the background of the tab. that is done elsewhere

param: g - the graphics context in which to paint
tabPlacement - the placement (left, right, bottom, top) of the tab
tabIndex - the index of the tab with respect to other tabs
isSelected - a boolean which determines whether or not the tab is selected
g - the graphics context in which to paint
tabPlacement - the placement (left, right, bottom, top) of the tab

isSelected - a boolean which determines whether or not the tab is selected

tabPlacement - the placement (left, right, bottom, top) of the tab
selectedIndex - the tab index of the selected component

members.comment: Paints the content border top edge.

param: g - the graphics context in which to paint
tabPlacement - the placement (left, right, bottom, top) of the tab
selectedIndex - the tab index of the selected component

tabPlacement - the placement (left, right, bottom, top) of the tab
selectedIndex - the tab index of the selected component

tabPlacement - the placement (left, right, bottom, top) of the tab
selectedIndex - the tab index of the selected component

members.name: getTabBounds
members.comment: Returns the bounds of the specified tab index. The bounds are with respect to the JTabbedPane's coordinate space.

return: the rectangle for the tab bounds

members.name: tabForCoordinate
members.comment: Returns the tab index which intersects the specified point in the JTabbedPane's coordinate space.

members.name: getTabBounds
members.comment: Returns the bounds of the specified tab in the coordinate space of the JTabbedPane component. This is required because the tab rects are by default defined in the coordinate space of the component where they are rendered, which could be the JTabbedPane (for WRAP_TAB_LAYOUT) or a ScrollableTabPanel (SCROLL_TAB_LAYOUT). This method should be used whenever the tab rectangle must be relative to the JTabbedPane itself and the result should be placed in a designated Rectangle object (rather than instantiating and returning a new Rectangle each time). The tab index parameter must be a valid tabbed pane tab index (0 to tab count - 1, inclusive). The destination rectangle parameter must be a valid Rectangle instance. The handling of invalid parameters is unspecified.

param: dest - the rectangle where the result should be placed

members.name: getRunForTab
members.comment: Returns the run for a tab.

members.name: lastTabInRun
members.comment: Returns the last tab in a run.

return: the last tab in a run

param: tabPlacement - the placement (left, right, bottom, top) of the tab
tabPlacement - the placement (left, right, bottom, top) of the tab

members.name: shouldPadTabRun
members.comment: Returns whether or not the tab run should be padded.

return: whether or not the tab run should be padded

members.name: shouldRotateTabRuns
members.comment: Returns whether or not the tab run should be rotated.

param: tabPlacement - the placement (left, right, bottom, top) of the tab
return: whether or not the tab run should be rotated

members.name: getIconForTab
members.comment: Returns the icon for a tab.

members.name: getTextViewForTab
members.comment: Returns the text View object required to render stylized text (HTML) for the specified tab or null if no specialized text rendering is needed for this tab. This is provided to support html rendering inside tabs.

return: the text view to render the tab's text or null if no specialized rendering is required

param: tabPlacement - the placement (left, right, bottom, top) of the tab
tabIndex - the index of the tab with respect to other tabs

name: javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicTabbedPaneUI
comment: A Basic L&F implementation of TabbedPaneUI.
